# The `GenericScheduler` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/genericscheduler">GenericScheduler</a> shrinks the unscheduled zone using heuristics to balance the schedule. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::GenericScheduler</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/genericscheduler">GenericScheduler</a> shrinks the unscheduled zone using heuristics to balance the schedule.

Definition at line 1223 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">MachineScheduler.h</a>.

### schedNode() {#adf574ab3455d7292bed998d8ba50bfeb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void GenericScheduler::schedNode (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU, bool IsTopNode)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Update the scheduler&#39;s state after scheduling a node.

This is the same node that was just returned by <a href="#ad4cc558b6cbcc4e9cea5df915c197e14">pickNode()</a>. However, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagmilive">ScheduleDAGMILive</a> needs to update it&#39;s state based on the current cycle before <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineschedstrategy">MachineSchedStrategy</a> does.

FIXME: Eventually, we may bundle physreg copies rather than rescheduling them here. See comments in biasPhysReg.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h/#l01247">1247</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">MachineScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinescheduler-cpp/#l03829">3829</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinescheduler-cpp">MachineScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### shouldTrackLaneMasks() {#ada10b0f311c10e4c89f7449fdd38b965}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::GenericScheduler::shouldTrackLaneMasks () const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Returns true if lanemasks should be tracked.

LaneMask tracking is necessary to reorder independent subregister defs for the same vreg. This has to be enabled in combination with <a href="#ab1ad1eb71432f2b381687717ced8b052">shouldTrackPressure()</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h/#l01239">1239</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">MachineScheduler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if pressure tracking is needed before building the DAG and initializing this strategy.

Called after initPolicy.

## Protected Member Functions

### checkAcyclicLatency() {#a0aa33f27fbf7be1e7e53512ceb6de885}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void GenericScheduler::checkAcyclicLatency ()"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Set IsAcyclicLatencyLimited if the acyclic path is longer than the cyclic critical path by more cycles than it takes to drain the instruction buffer.

We estimate an upper bounds on in-flight instructions as:

CyclesPerIteration = max( CyclicPath, Loop-Resource-Height ) InFlightIterations = AcyclicPath / CyclesPerIteration InFlightResources = InFlightIterations &#42; LoopResources

TODO: <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> execution resources in addition to IssueCount.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h/#l01279">1279</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">MachineScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinescheduler-cpp/#l03341">3341</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinescheduler-cpp">MachineScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tryCandidate() {#a6ef23d22af6c895d9c255de3e940b8bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool GenericScheduler::tryCandidate (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp; Cand, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp; TryCand, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/schedboundary">SchedBoundary</a> &#42; Zone) const</>}
  labels = {["protected", "virtual"]}>
Apply a set of heuristics to a new candidate.

Heuristics are currently hierarchical. This may be more efficient than a graduated cost model because we don&#39;t need to evaluate all aspects of the model for each node in the queue. But it&#39;s really done to make the heuristics easier to debug and statistically analyze.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Cand">provides the policy and current best candidate.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="TryCand">refers to the next <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> candidate, otherwise uninitialized.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Zone">describes the scheduled zone that we are extending, or nullptr if Cand is from a different zone than TryCand.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
<code>true</code> if TryCand is better than Cand (Reason is NOT NoCand)
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h/#l01285">1285</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">MachineScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinescheduler-cpp/#l03524">3524</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinescheduler-cpp">MachineScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
